NEWS 07/15 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs NEWS 07/2015 Fassmer-Azubi gewinnt Preis des Arbeitgeberverbandes Jessica Mollzahn, Auszubildende zur Industriekauffrau bei der Fr. Fassmer GmbH & Co. KG, hat am 23.07.2015 den „Kompass 2015 – Kurs Erfolg“, den Auszubildenden-Preis des Arbeitgeberverbandes Oldenburg für besonders kreative, engagierte und qualifizierte Auszubildende, gewonnen. Gesucht wurden Auszubildende, die nicht nur gute Leistungen im Betrieb und in der Berufsschule zeigen, sondern die sich auch durch engagierte Mitarbeit im Unternehmen und außerberufliche Aktivitäten auszeichnen. Aus den zahlreichen Bewerbungen wurden 5 „Nominierte“ zur Preisverleihung am 23.07.2015 nach Oldenburg eingeladen, darunter auch Jessica Mollzahn, Auszubildende im 2. Ausbildungsjahr. Aufgrund ihres erfolgreichen sportlichen Engagements als Kunstradsportlerin und als Trainerin von Nachwuchssportlern in ihrem Wohnort Neuenkirchen und aufgrund ihres positiven Einsatzes im Unternehmen (z.B. Unterstützung der Organisation einer Spendentombola, Mitglied in der Jugend- und Auszubildendenvertretung) und in der Berufsschule (freiwilliger Besuch eines Zusatz-Unterrichts, um parallel zur Ausbildung die Fachhochschulreife zu erwerben) schlug Fassmer sie für den Kompass 2015 vor. Die Freude war groß, als Jessica Mollzahn von Herrn Lehmann, Hauptgeschäftsführer des AGV Oldenburg, als Gewinnerin genannt wurde. Neben Herrn Waskönig, dem Vorsitzenden des geschäftsführenden Vorstands des AGV Oldenburg, gratulierte auch Fassmer-Geschäftsführer Holger Fassmer im Namen des gesamten Fassmer-Teams sehr herzlich zu dieser schönen Anerkennung, die mit einem Preisgeld von 1.000,- € verbunden ist.

NEWS 06/15 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs NEWS 06/2015 Neuer 28-Meter-Seenotkreuzer getauft Zur Taufe von SK 35 und seinem Tochterboot TB 39 hat die DGzRS zahlreiche Gäste und Tausende von Freunden und Förderern der Seenotretter aus nah und fern begrüßt. Karin Fahrenschon, Ehefrau von Georg Fahrenschon, Präsident des Deutschen Sparkassen- und Giroverbandes, Hauptsponsor der Jubiläumsveranstaltungen der DGzRS, taufte den Seenotkreuzer auf den Namen ERNST MEIER-HEDDE. Sie wünschte „allzeit gute Fahrt und der Besatzung stets eine sichere Heimkehr“. Das Tochterboot wurde von Nicole Keller, einer Enkelin Meier-Heddes, auf den Namen ihrer Großmutter und Meier-Heddes Ehefrau LOTTE getauft. Für den musikalischen Rahmen sorgten Musiker des Bundespolizeiorchesters aus Hannover. Die ERNST MEIER-HEDDE ist das Typschiff der völlig neuen 28-Meter-Klasse. Die jüngste und modernste Bootsklasse der DGzRS ist konzipiert als leistungsfähiger Nachfolgetyp der sechs 27,5-Meter-Seenotrettungskreuzer, die zwischen 1985 und 1992 in Dienst gestellt wurden. Die neue Einheit löst im Zuge der Modernisierung der Rettungsflotte den Seenotrettungskreuzer VORMANN LEISS (Baujahr 1985) auf der Station Amrum ab. Erste Probefahrten haben stattgefunden und sehr positive Ergebnisse gebracht. Vor der endgültigen Stationierung wird der Neubau weitere umfangreiche Erprobungen absolvieren. Das 24 Knoten (ca. 46 km/h) schnelle Schiff wird von einer vier Mann starken Besatzung gefahren. Besondere Merkmale sind eine umfassende Ausrüstung zur medizinischen Erstversorgung an Bord, eine Feuerlöschpumpe mit ferngelenktem Monitor zur Bekämpfung von Bränden auf See und die Fähigkeit, sich im Falle des Durchkenterns innerhalb weniger Sekunden selbst wieder aufzurichten. In der für Seenotrettungskreuzer typischen Heckwanne führen die 28-Meter-Einheiten jeweils ein gut acht Meter langes Tochterboot mit sich. Der Reeder Ernst Meier-Hedde (1913-1994), Mitbegründer der Bremer Schlüssel-Reederei für Massengutschiffe, war von 1980 bis 1990 elf Jahre lang ehrenamtlicher Vorsitzer der Seenotretter. Sein Engagement war bestimmt von dem Bestreben, den Seenotrettern stets ein Höchstmaß an Sicherheit an Bord zu geben – als wichtigste Voraussetzung für den erfolgreichen Einsatz auf See. Seine im Beruf gewonnenen Erfahrungen stellte er voll in den Dienst der DGzRS. Durch sein vorbildliches Wirken, seine menschliche Haltung im Dienst der humanitären Aufgabe und sein Fachwissen prägte er das Bild der DGzRS im In- und Ausland nachhaltig. Mit der Namengebung würdigt die DGzRS indirekt ein zweites Jubiläum des Jahres 2015: Vor 25 Jahren, unter dem Vorsitz von Ernst Meier-Hedde, kehrte die Gesellschaft auf ihre angestammten Stationen in Mecklenburg-Vorpommern zurück. Die Wiedervereinigung der Seenotretter aus Ost und West war ein Höhepunkt seiner Tätigkeit. Die Eckdaten der neuen Klasse: Länge über Alles: 27,90 Meter Breite über Alles: 6,2 Meter Tiefgang: 2,00 Meter Geschwindigkeit: 24 Knoten (ca. 45 km/h) Besatzung: 9/4 Pers. (Stamm/Einsatz) Antrieb: zwei Propeller, je 1.440 kW/1.958 PS = 2.880 kW/3.916 PS Verdrängung: 120 Tonnen Quelle und weitere Informationen: DGzRS/Die Seenotretter

Philosophy - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company DE Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Composite Technology Caravan Panelling Automotive Amusement and Rides Industry Technologies Research and Development Philosophy Construction and Consultation Idea to Series Product Optimization Customers and synergies We are committed to a single aim: to provide the best result for our customers. That is why the only reasonable production approach is to work together with our customers, to know precisely their requirements and wishes – and then try to find the best solution. For the innovative market of FRP Products we can learn a lot from nature. So it is not only important to observe optimal functioning systems and composites in nature but also the principles for construction as well. Fassmer is ahead of the competition, not only because of all these features but also because of all the synergies within the company – that is really a strong bond of competence!

Methods of Production - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company DE Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Composite Technology Caravan Panelling Automotive Amusement and Rides Industry Technologies Methods of Production Hand lay-up Technique Vacuum Infusion RTM Press Moulding CNC Materials Tool Making Automation Research and Development Set standards for innovative solutions Fassmer is an expert in the entire spectrum of technologies used in manufacturing components and assemblies made of composite materials, from hand lay-up through to Resin Transfer Moulding (RTM) processes and vacuum infusion technique of even very large GRP components (plus cold press moulding in the field of composite technology). In co-operation with its customers, Fassmer selects the best combination of moulding and production techniques which are best suited for each particular component. The production method chosen always depends on several aspects: geometry of the parts strengths and wall thickness requested weight general requirements of the parts quantity of series components

Industry - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company DE Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Composite Technology Caravan Panelling Automotive Amusement and Rides Industry Technologies Research and Development Industry In this area the percentage of FRP-components is growing continuously. Producers of agricultural implements and railway and construction vehicles appreciate the low weight, the unlimited forming and low prices for serial production.

Amusement and Rides - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company DE Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Composite Technology Caravan Panelling Automotive Amusement and Rides FRP slides and FRP pools FRP white water boats after pretreatment FRP white water boats during reconstruction with laminate FRP white water boats with final topcoat paint FRP slides „work of all sorts“ FRP equipment and decoration methods Industry Technologies Research and Development FRP new components, repair, renovation, building alterations and coatings for amusement parks and pools of all kind A flexible and economical use of glass fibre reinforced plastics (FR P) Exceptional expertise, and the most modern production processes A fine design, high functionality and economic effectiveness – FRP allows the perfect combination of several product relevant factors. Additionally, the use of FRP gives designers a lot of freedom. That is especially important if it is impossible to use other materials. At Fassmer’s, we offer a one-stop service depending on your wishes: Product development and beautification Plugs, moulds, forms and additional services, e.g. varnish Finished components Diverse possibilities, and an endless variety of forms Apart from producing new components, Fassmer also offers FRP repair, renovation and preparation worldwide. As Fassmer has specialized in this high-tech sector, the FRP application area is accordingly manifold and flexible. Among other things, we produce in the following areas: FRP water slides and pools of any kind FRP boats FRP rides FRP figures FRP cowlings FRP coatings

Automotive - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company DE Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Composite Technology Caravan Panelling Automotive Amusement and Rides Industry Technologies Research and Development Automotive Fassmer delivers countless components to clients of automobile industry and producers of caravans and campmobiles.

Caravan Panelling - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company DE Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Composite Technology Caravan Panelling Automotive Amusement and Rides Industry Technologies Research and Development Caravan Panelling Because of various reasons nearly the whole outer hull is made up by diverse plastic materials nowadays. On the one hand these materials are much lighter than conventional ones and on the other hand they can be designed three-dimensionally very well. This means designers to have unlimited possibilities in forming and the additional loading of a vehicle is less affected. Fassmer delivers FRP-components as roofs, shells, walls, coverings, fenders and valves for caravans and campmobiles.

Composite Technology - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company DE Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Composite Technology Caravan Panelling Automotive Amusement and Rides Industry Technologies Research and Development Material of the future Fibre-reinforced composites combine exceptional rigidity, strength and corrosion resistance with very low weight . These qualities make them the preferred choice for many innovative applications. Fassmer is one of the European leaders in the FRP industry . Long experience and ongoing further development make Fassmer a reliable and versatile partner for FRP systems and components. Optimum production processes and advanced automation technology guarantee maximum economy and quality.

Offshore Service Solutions - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Wind Power Spinners and Nacelles Offshore Service Solutions Helicopter Winching Area Windlift Survival Cells Service Boats Technologies Research and Development The Offshore experience Ahead of the competition Fassmer can build on its own long offshore experience in shipbuilding and deck equipment. So the company offers innovative products like the windlift, helicopter winching area and emergency cells. These Fassmer products guarantee maximum safety, availability and comfort in an offshore wind park.

Spinners and Nacelles - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Wind Power Spinners and Nacelles Offshore Service Solutions Technologies Research and Development Spinners and Nacelles Producing spinner and nacelle covers has a long tradition at Fassmer, which has always used materials of high quality, strength, corrosion resistance and very low weight, not only FRP (Fibre Reinforced Plastics) but also aluminium. As one of the European leaders , Fassmer offers optimized production processes and guarantees maximum economy and quality. Within the windpower business Fassmer has been supplying various turbine manufacturers for more than 15 years (e.g. REpower, Enercon, GE Wind and many others). Fassmer is a complete system supplier. In addition to manufacturing components, we also integrate fittings, bolt-on units, weather stations and complete hydraulic and electrical assemblies. This approach eliminates interfacing problems. You benefit from having just one contact partner right through from development to after-sales service.

onshore & offshore Windpower - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Wind Power Spinners and Nacelles Offshore Service Solutions Technologies Research and Development Competence for Wind-powered Solutions The operating goals of Fassmer are top quality and customer satisfaction . An expert in-house design and engineering team backed up by modern production facilities provides Fassmer with an exceptional capacity for innovation and ingenious technical solutions in wind power. Fassmer's clients can take advantage of synergies between its six business areas: Shipbuilding, Lifeboats, Deck Equipment, Composite Technology, Wind Power and After-Sales Service. So in the innovative market of wind power customers can profit from cumulative competence and state-of-the-art production facilities . A wide range of products convinces Fassmer's clients — beginning with the FRP- and aluminium components for spinners and nacelles, continuing to whole systems with all required equipment and last but not least the offshore components with boat launching systems, helicopter winching areas and service boats for offshore wind parks.

Highly qualified employees and the permanent testing of innovative materials and production techniques help to meet all demands. Nowadays there are numerous requirements relating to environmental protection, for example, or in working towards sustainability and stability features. That is a great challenge for the future – for our customers and for a better world!

Idea to Series - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company DE Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Composite Technology Caravan Panelling Automotive Amusement and Rides Industry Technologies Research and Development Philosophy Construction and Consultation Idea to Series Product Optimization Idea to Series Fassmer has experience in supporting customers from the preliminary design and engineering through to the production. We have a total of approx. 70 engineers in our construction department. The design and engineering of our projects is always carried out in co-operation between the customer and Fassmer. Everything is based on the customer’s needs and requirements. From the idea to the serial production we can support you. Generation of an idea Design and engineering Plug building Mould building Prototype building Serial production

We do not leave them to solve their problems alone, but consult them in every step of the process of production. Fassmer customers will never walk alone at any stage of the production process – from the first idea, the production, construction and implementation up to the maintenance of course.

Gelcoat Applicator - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company DE Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Composite Technology Caravan Panelling Automotive Amusement and Rides Industry Technologies Methods of Production Materials Tool Making Automation CNC Robots Gelcoat Applicator Research and Development Gelcoat Applicator On our multi-colour-gelcoat lines we are able to cover different gelcoat colours within very short time and without a big cleaning effort.

GFK - Forschung und Entwicklung - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company EN Sitemap Impressum GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Faserverbundtechnik Wohnmobil Verkleidungen Automobilindustrie Freizeitindustrie industrie Technologien Forschung und Entwicklung Philosophie Konstruktion und Beratung Von der Idee zur Serienfertigung Produktoptimierung Kundenzufriedenheit Unser vorrangiges Ziel ist die Schaffung einer hohen Kundenzufriedenheit sowie einer partnerschaftlichen Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Kunden und Partnern. Nur wer die genauen Anforderungen und Wünsche seiner Kunden kennt, ist in der Lage, die optimalsten und wirtschaftlichsten Lösungen zu finden. Im innovativen GFK-Markt können wir viel von der Natur lernen. Nur wenn alle Parameter richtig aufeinander abgestimmt sind, kann ein System wie auch in der Natur optimal funktionieren. Dieses Wissen sowie die Erfahrungen aus artverwandten Produktbereichen fließen mit in unsere Konstruktionen ein. Fassmer ist führend in der Verarbeitung von GFK, CFK, Composites, Fibreglas etc.

GFK - Technologie - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company EN Sitemap Impressum GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Faserverbundtechnik Wohnmobil Verkleidungen Automobilindustrie Freizeitindustrie industrie Technologien Methoden der Produktion Handlaminieren Vakuuminfusion RTM (Harzspritzpressverfahren) Formpressen Formpressen Materialien Werkzeugherstellung Automatisierung Forschung und Entwicklung Standards für innovative Lösungen setzen Fassmer ist ein Fachbetrieb im Bereich der Herstellung von Komponenten und Baugruppen aus Verbundwerkstoffen sogenannten Composites. Diese können aus Glasfaser, Kohlefaser oder auch Aramid bestehen im Verbund mit einem Harz (Matrix) auf Polyester-, Epoxid-, oder Vinylesterbasis. In Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Kunden wählen wir die Kombination aus Form- und Produktionsverfahren, die am besten für jede einzelne Komponente geeignet ist. Die ausgewählte Produktionsmethode hängt stets von folgenden Punkten ab: Geometrie der Teile geforderte Festigkeitseigenschaften und Wanddicke Gewicht Toleranzen allgemeine Anforderungen an die Teile Menge der seriengefertigten Teile

GFK - Industrie - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company EN Sitemap Impressum GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Faserverbundtechnik Wohnmobil Verkleidungen Automobilindustrie Freizeitindustrie industrie Technologien Forschung und Entwicklung Industrie In diesem Bereich nimmt der Anteil an GFK-Komponenten kontinuierlich zu. Hersteller von landwirtschaftlichen Geräten, Schienen- und Baufahrzeugen sowie der Hochbau wissen das geringe Gewicht, die unbegrenzte Formenvielfalt und die niedrigen Kosten für die Serienproduktion zu schätzen.

GFK - Freizeitindustrie - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company EN Sitemap Impressum GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Faserverbundtechnik Wohnmobil Verkleidungen Automobilindustrie Freizeitindustrie GFK Rutschen und GFK Pools GFK Wildwasserboote nach einer Vorbehandlung GFK Wildwasserboote während der Rekonstruktion mit Laminat GFK Wildwasserboote mit Decklack Farbe GFK Rutschen GFK Ausstattung und Dekoration Methoden industrie Technologien Forschung und Entwicklung Freizeitindustrie Ein wachsender Markt für den vielseitigen und wirtschaftlichen Einsatz von glasfaserverstärkten Kunststoffen (GFK) Langjähriges Know-how, modernste Herstellungsverfahren, gutes Design, hohe Funktionalität und Wirtschaftlichkeit – mit GFK lassen sich gleich mehrere produktrelevante Faktoren optimal miteinander verbinden. Der Einsatz von GFK eröffnet Planern zudem viele Freiheiten. Vor allem dann, wenn andere Werkstoffe an ihre Grenzen kommen. Auf Wunsch erhalten Sie bei Fassmer alles aus einer Hand: Statische Bauteilauslegung, Berechnungen, Abnahmen und Prüfungen Urmodelle Negativformen, Werkzeuge und Vorrichtungen für die GFK-Fertigung Komponenten und Formteile sowie komplette Montagegruppen Ergänzende Leistungen wie Lackierung und Airbrush Logistik Faserverbundwerkstoffe: Vielfältige Möglichkeiten und grenzenlose Formvielfalt Neben der Neufertigung von Bauteilen bietet Fassmer weltweit auch die GFK-Reparatur, GFK-Sanierung und Aufbereitung von GFK an. Fassmer hat sich auch auf diesen Technologiebereich spezialisiert. Folgende Themen gehören zum Portfolio: GFK Wasserrutschen jeglicher Art GFK Boote GFK Fahrgeschäfte GFK Figuren GFK Verkleidungen GFK Beschichtungen Formenbau GFK Mock Up´s Prototypen GFK Hauben aus GFK Rinnen aus GFK Wannen aus GFK Konstruktionen aus GFK GFK Reparatur GFK Sanierung GFK Berechnung Abdeckungen aus GFK

GFK - Automobilindustrie Fertigung - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company EN Sitemap Impressum GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Faserverbundtechnik Wohnmobil Verkleidungen Automobilindustrie Freizeitindustrie industrie Technologien Forschung und Entwicklung Automobil Fassmer fertigt und liefert GFK/Composite-Komponenten an Kunden aus der Automobilindustrie sowie an Hersteller von Wohnwagen, Wohnmobilen und Sonderfahrzeugen wie z.B. Krankenwagen. Auf Kundenwusch übernimmt Fassmer die gesamte Logistikkette bis hin zur „just in time“ Anlieferung.

GFK - Wohnwagen und Wohnmobil - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company EN Sitemap Impressum GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Faserverbundtechnik Wohnmobil Verkleidungen Automobilindustrie Freizeitindustrie industrie Technologien Forschung und Entwicklung Wohnmobil Verkleidungen aus Faserverbundwerkstoffen Aus verschiedenen Gründen besteht heutzutage praktisch die gesamte Außenhülle aus diversen Kunststoffen. Zum einen sind solche Werkstoffe viel leichter als herkömmliche Materialien, zum anderen sind der Formgestaltung kaum Grenzen gesetzt. Den Konstrukteuren und Designern stehen somit alle Möglichkeiten offen, Exterior, Funktionalität und Gewicht zu optimieren. Fassmer fertigt und liefert Komponenten wie z.B. GFK-Dächer, GFK-Hutzen, GFK-Wände, GFK-Abdeckungen, B-Säulen sowie Frontmasken, Alkoven und sonstige Formteile aus GFK für Wohnwagen und Wohnmobile.

Glasfaser verstärkter Kunststoff (GFK) - Fertigung & Reparatur - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company EN Sitemap Impressum GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Faserverbundtechnik Wohnmobil Verkleidungen Automobilindustrie Freizeitindustrie industrie Technologien Forschung und Entwicklung Glasfaserverstärkter Kunststoff (GFK) – Das Material der Zukunft Faserverbundstoffe/Composites vereinen außergewöhnliche Eigenschaften: hohe mechanische Kennwerte, Witterungs- und Medienbeständigkeit sowie ein geringes spezifisches Gewicht. Diese Eigenschaften sind die Basis zur Realisierung von vielen innovativen Anwendungen/Bauteilen. Fassmer ist eines der führenden europäischen Unternehmen in der GFK-Composite-Branche. Über 50 Jahre Erfahrung und ständige Weiterentwicklung machen Fassmer zum zuverlässigen und vielseitigen Partner für GFK-Systeme und Composite-Komponenten. GFK - Technologie - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company EN Sitemap Impressum GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Faserverbundtechnik Wohnmobil Verkleidungen Automobilindustrie Freizeitindustrie industrie Technologien Methoden der Produktion Handlaminieren Vakuuminfusion RTM (Harzspritzpressverfahren) Formpressen Formpressen Materialien Werkzeugherstellung Automatisierung Forschung und Entwicklung Standards für innovative Lösungen setzen Fassmer ist ein Fachbetrieb im Bereich der Herstellung von Komponenten und Baugruppen aus Verbundwerkstoffen sogenannten Composites. Philosophy - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company DE Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Composite Technology Caravan Panelling Automotive Amusement and Rides Industry Technologies Research and Development Philosophy Construction and Consultation Idea to Series Product Optimization Customers and synergies We are committed to a single aim: to provide the best result for our customers. That is why the only reasonable production approach is to work together with our customers, to know precisely their requirements and wishes – and then try to find the best solution. For the innovative market of FRP Products we can learn a lot from nature. So it is not only important to observe optimal functioning systems and composites in nature but also the principles for construction as well. Fassmer is ahead of the competition, not only because of all these features but also because of all the synergies within the company – that is really a strong bond of competence!

GFRP - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company DE Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Composite Technology Caravan Panelling Automotive Amusement and Rides Industry Technologies Methods of Production Materials GFRP CFRP Tool Making Automation Research and Development GFRP (Glass-Fibre-Reinforced Plastic) Glass-fibre-reinforced plastic is the most frequently used material for fibre reinforced plastic. There are two main reasons: The first one is the uncomplicated processing of these materials and the other one is to be very cost-effective compared to carbon-fibre-reinforced plastic and aramide.

Materials - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company DE Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Composite Technology Caravan Panelling Automotive Amusement and Rides Industry Technologies Methods of Production Materials GFRP CFRP Tool Making Automation Research and Development Simply the best Nowadays fibre reinforced plastics take an increasingly important role in the production of components in diverse industrial branches. There are numerous convincing advantages: low weight combined with high stability and rigidity (especially sandwich components) excellent corrosion features weather-resistant unlimited design possibilities according to forming resistant against a big number of chemicals tolerance stable high durability good thermic and sound damping features recyclable (can be used as filler material when ground) diverse fire protection classifications can be reached by mixing additives The decision of using fibre reinforced plastics, carbon fibres or aramide depends on special challenges and application features.

Product Optimization - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Wind Power Spinners and Nacelles Offshore Service Solutions Technologies Research and Development Philosophy Construction and Consultation Idea to Series Product Optimization Peak performance in a fascinating market Of course scientists and Fassmer engineers continue to work on improvements to our products. Highly qualified employees and the permanent testing of innovative materials and production techniques help to meet all demands. Nowadays there are numerous requirements relating to environmental protection, for example, or in working towards sustainability and stability features. That is a great challenge for the future – for our customers and for a better world!

Idea to Series - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Wind Power Spinners and Nacelles Offshore Service Solutions Technologies Research and Development Philosophy Construction and Consultation Idea to Series Product Optimization Idea to Series Fassmer has experience in supporting customers from the preliminary design and engineering through to the production. We have a total of approx. 70 engineers in our construction department. The design and engineering of our projects is always carried out in co-operation between the customer and Fassmer. Everything is based on the customer’s needs and requirements. From the idea to the serial production we can support you. Generation of an idea Design and engineering Plug building Mould building Prototype building Serial production

We do not leave them to solve their problems alone, but consult them in every step of the process of production. Fassmer customers will never walk alone at any stage of the production process – from the first idea, the production, construction and implementation up to the maintenance of course.

GFK (Glasfaser verstärkter Kunststoff) - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company EN Sitemap Impressum GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Faserverbundtechnik Wohnmobil Verkleidungen Automobilindustrie Freizeitindustrie industrie Technologien Methoden der Produktion Materialien GFK (Glasfaser verstärkter Kunststoff) CFK (Kohlefaser verstärkter Kunststoff) Werkzeugherstellung Automatisierung Forschung und Entwicklung GFK (Glasfaser verstärkter Kunststoff) Glasfaser verstärkter Kunststoff ist die am häufigsten verwendete Variante faserverstärkter Kunststoffe. Hierfür gibt es zwei Gründe: zum einen die unkomplizierte Verarbeitung dieses Materials, zum anderen seine enorme Kosteneffizienz im Vergleich zu kohlefaserverstärkten Kunststoffen und Aramid.

Negative Moulds - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Wind Power Spinners and Nacelles Offshore Service Solutions Technologies Methods of Production Materials Tool Making Master Plugs Negative Moulds Automation Research and Development Negative moulds Normally Fassmer produces working tools from fibre-reinforced materials based on the masterplugs. On demand additional alternatives as the galvanic forms for the press moulding can also be offered. According to type and use the tools can be delivered as heated models. Our delivery range consists of a big variety of tools, beginning with a negative mould for the hand lay-up technique via tools for vacuum infusion up to RTM-tools or press tools.

Master Plugs - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Wind Power Spinners and Nacelles Offshore Service Solutions Technologies Methods of Production Materials Tool Making Master Plugs Negative Moulds Automation Research and Development Master plugs The master plug acts as a basis of a negative plug and can be produced in different ways. Often the following components decide on the way of construction. For example : The wooden plug in veneered frame construction The styrofoam core with glass-fibre-coats in cut finishing The styrofoam core coated with PU-paste in cut finishing On demand we deliver a measurement report for all types of master plugs.

Aluminium - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Wind Power Spinners and Nacelles Offshore Service Solutions Technologies Methods of Production Materials GFRP CFRP Aluminium Tool Making Automation Research and Development Aluminium The premium plus factors of aluminum are a better thermal conductivity , the recycling potential of the material and the effect of lightning protection as well. A three-dimensional forming of the components is more difficult with aluminum than with fibre-reinforce-plastic (especially for sandwich-construction).

Survival Cells - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Wind Power Spinners and Nacelles Offshore Service Solutions Helicopter Winching Area Windlift Survival Cells Service Boats Technologies Research and Development Survival Cells This custom-made cabin is constructed to provide life support or overnight stays for service personal or castaways . It is a self-supporting modular unit that can be positioned to suit different tower dimensions. Fassmer has developed a very comfortable survival cell with different features. Thermal insulation Independent ventilation/ heating systems Accommodation for three persons for 2-3 days Sanitary block Tower docking devices Railing system All equipment and fitments can be added and dimensions can be changed according to customers‘ wishes.

Windlift - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Wind Power Spinners and Nacelles Offshore Service Solutions Helicopter Winching Area Windlift Survival Cells Service Boats Technologies Research and Development Windlift This is really an ingenious invention. Service ships for offshore wind turbines can approach and dock from any direction, even in bad weather situations. The height-adjustable windlift completely eliminates the need for climbing ladders , which can be very risky in rough seas. As soon as the technicians and their equipment are on the platform the windlift is raised to an elevated position. It can carry loads of up to 6 metric tonnes . The Fassmer Windlift is made entirely of seawater-resistant aluminium and needs no maintenance. The system can be tailored around different kinds of foundations/ transmission pieces and towers – always according the customer’s requirements. For most of its lifetime the windlift in an offshore wind turbine will be kept out of the highly demanding splash water zone. Equipped with four landing sides the system guarantees a safe landing according to wind, sea conditions and flow conditions. This concept offers numerous advantages compared with conventional systems: Accessibility of the wind turbine up to +/-2 m significant wave height Docking from diverse directions (important during different wind, sea and flow conditions)) Possibility of crossing from the side to the bow In its resting position high above the sea level the wind lift is protected against wind and waves. Above all this means there is no plant cover and the lift has no increase of resistance when diving into the sea. Safe transfer to the platform (parallel to the boat, like the pilot´s crossing) without dangerous climbing when boarding A wind lift not only increases the availability of the wind turbines but also improves the maintenance processes and reduces operational costs . But first and foremost the security of service employees is dramatically increased.

Helicopter Winching Area - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Wind Power Spinners and Nacelles Offshore Service Solutions Helicopter Winching Area Windlift Survival Cells Service Boats Technologies Research and Development Helicopter Winching Area Fassmer produces helicopter winching areas suitable for offshore and inshore wind turbines. They are made from totally corrosion-resistant FRP materials or aluminium . This platform functions as a safe working area for service technicians and materials after having been heli-lifted on. Opening a platform grid gives safe access to the hatch which leads to the turbine. The platform can also be used for winch rescues of injured persons. This system is compatible with: Emergency lowering points for descent systems Helicopter guides, lights/balls Hoisting davits for spare parts Wind measuring instruments

onshore & offshore Windpower - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Wind Power Spinners and Nacelles Offshore Service Solutions Technologies Research and Development Competence for Wind-powered Solutions The operating goals of Fassmer are top quality and customer satisfaction . Slewing Arm Davits - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Deck Equipment Boarding Systems Davits Pivot Davits Multi-pivot Davits Freefall Pivots Hydraulic Davits Outrigger Davits Slewing Arm Davits Gangways Working rafts-/ baskets Bulwark ladder and swivel platforms Winches After-Sales Service Global Service Net Slewing Arm Rescue Davit (FSAR) and Slewing Arm Rescue and Raft Davit (FSARR) This Fassmer davit is suitable for rescue boats up to 21 kN launching weight and for liferafts for up to 25 persons. The slewing of the davit is effected hydraulically, as required by the IMO/ Solas. The winch is power operated for hoisting and is lowered by gravity. The system can be turned out, lowered, recovered and turned in with the crew on board either from deck position or inside the boat. The FSARR davit employs the same principle, but can also be used to operate liferafts.

Outrigger Davits - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Deck Equipment Boarding Systems Davits Pivot Davits Multi-pivot Davits Freefall Pivots Hydraulic Davits Outrigger Davits Slewing Arm Davits Gangways Working rafts-/ baskets Bulwark ladder and swivel platforms Winches After-Sales Service Global Service Net Fassmer Outrigger Davit The Fassmer outrigger davit is designed for compact stowing, easy launching and recovery of Fassmer fully-enclosed lifeboats . It is supplied with an electric/hydraulic powered winch with a hydraulic brake system and a double hydraulic wind system. For tanker or platform installation a version with explosion proof is available for rescue boats (FSAR) and combined vessels (FSARR).

Hydraulic Davits - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Deck Equipment Boarding Systems Davits Pivot Davits Multi-pivot Davits Freefall Pivots Hydraulic Davits Outrigger Davits Slewing Arm Davits Gangways Working rafts-/ baskets Bulwark ladder and swivel platforms Winches After-Sales Service Global Service Net Fassmer Hydraulic Davit The Fassmer hydraulic davit is a perfect combination of gravity supported by hydraulic operation . The hydraulic cylinder pushes the davit arms as long as gravity permits. The hydraulic operation avoids complicated operation with any kind of bowsing gear as the cylinder holds the boat tightly to the ship structure for easy and safe embarkation . The combination of gravity and hydraulic allows for an installation off the limit of pure gravity operation.

Freefall Pivots - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Deck Equipment Boarding Systems Davits Pivot Davits Multi-pivot Davits Freefall Pivots Hydraulic Davits Outrigger Davits Slewing Arm Davits Gangways Working rafts-/ baskets Bulwark ladder and swivel platforms Winches After-Sales Service Global Service Net Fassmer Freefall Hydraulic Pivot The Fassmer freefall hydraulic davit is a high-performance deck-mounted system with deck or under-deck hydraulics for Fassmer freefall lifeboats between 55 and 75 kN. Hydraulic recovery with the crew on board is possible. Stainless steel shafts are used to reduce maintenance to a minimum. For all sizes a simulated launch device is available. This device enables the crew to perform a drop without releasing the freefall all the way down into the water.

Multi-pivot Davits - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Deck Equipment Boarding Systems Davits Pivot Davits Multi-pivot Davits Freefall Pivots Hydraulic Davits Outrigger Davits Slewing Arm Davits Gangways Working rafts-/ baskets Bulwark ladder and swivel platforms Winches After-Sales Service Global Service Net Fassmer Multi-pivot Davit The Fassmer multi-pivot davit is an optimised pivot davit as regards installation height. This davit has an additional pivot point to reduce the overall height. Embarkation is possible in stowed position or when the vessel browsing gear is in operation. The Fassmer multi-pivot davit ensures compact execution when installed within a limited space. The turning-out of the manned craft and the lowering of the fully loaded craft are controlled by gravity. All davits are made of premium materials to ensure a maximum lifetime with a minimum of maintenance activities and spare parts. In combination with the Fassmer Duplex Release Hook System the entire launching process can be supervised by a single person which provides a maximum of safety.

Praktikum - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Jobs Stellenangebote Ausbildung Duales Studium Praktikum Schüler-Praktikum Noch ist dein Hafen die Schule. Aber du willst schon jetzt die Berufswelt kennenlernen. Nimm das Steuer in die Hand und bewirb dich bei Fassmer für ein Schüler-Praktikum im handwerklichen, technischen oder kaufmännischen Bereich. Wir geben dir die Chance, deine Fähigkeiten in der Praxis zu zeigen und weiter auszubauen. Dabei erhältst du Einblicke in deinen gewünschten Ausbildungsberuf und in die täglichen Abläufe innerhalb eines weltweit erfolgreichen Familienunternehmens. Damit bewirbst du dich: Kurzes Anschreiben mit Angaben zum späteren Berufswunsch und Zeitraum des Praktikums Lebenslauf mit Foto aktuelle Zeugniskopien Praktikum für Studierende / Abschlussarbeiten Für Ihren Diplom-, Bachelor- oder Master- Studiengang benötigen Sie ein Grund- bzw. Fachpraktikum? Ein Praxis-Semester? Oder ein Projekt für Ihre Abschlussarbeit? Dann sind Sie bei Fassmer genau richtig. Nutzen Sie die Möglichkeit, von der jahrzehntelangen Erfahrung und dem fundierten Know-how eines weltweit agierenden Familienunternehmens zu profitieren. Wir freuen uns auf Sie. Duales Studium - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Jobs Stellenangebote Ausbildung Duales Studium Praktikum Zur Unterstützung unseres Teams suchen wir eine/n Dualen Student (m/w) Die perfekte Kombination Du hast Abitur oder Fachhochschulreife. Und du stehst vor der Wahl: Studium oder Ausbildung. Bei Fassmer kannst du dich für beides entscheiden. Wir bieten dir eine Ausbildung in Zusammenarbeit mit einer Dualen Hochschule in Bremen, Wilhelmshaven und Stade. Und so funktioniert’s: Deine praktischen Fähigkeiten erhältst du in unserem Unternehmen, die theoretischen als Studierende/r an einer der Hochschulen. Durch die enge Verknüpfung von Theorie und Praxis kannst du Gelerntes gezielter einsetzen und später schneller in deinen Beruf starten. Bewirb dich für ein Duales Studium der Fachrichtungen Schiffbau, Maschinenbau oder Verbundwerkstoffe. Unsere Fachrichtungen: Schiffbau und Meerestechnik 2016 Maschinenbau 2016 Verbundwerkstoffe / Composites 2016 Unsere Anforderungen: • Ein gutes Abitur oder Fachhochschulreife • Handwerkliches Geschick, technisches Verständnis und räumliches Vorstellungsvermögen • Engagement und Freude am Lernen Ausbildungsbeginn: Immer zum 01. KG Annette Büchner Industriestraße 2 27804 Berne · Germany jobs@fassmer.de www.fassmer.de

History - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Capacities Global Contact Net History Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Jobs A story of success In 1850 Johannes Fassmer set up his own business with plenty of shipbuilding competence, energy and perseverance. The company business in those early years focused on small wooden boats and life-boats. Today Holger and Harald Fassmer lead a company with more than 900 employees in the fifth generation and have gained an excellent national and international reputation.

Responsibility - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Jobs Being respectful and social Fassmer acts according to strict values concerning high quality, sustainability, environmental and social responsibility. All our employees are committed to provide the best products for our customers. We not only demand a lot from our employees; we offer them a lot, too. We are aware that we have a high responsibility for their social welfare, their security and their health. So we work constantly to improve the working conditions and care for our staff’s health. Within our company transparency and communication are very important. We further these features in our working processes. Employees are expected to treat each other in a respectful manner at all times. We respect our employees, with all their strengths and weaknesses. We take our environmental responsibility seriously and constantly work to improve our waste management, for example. We also use sustainable long-lasting materials.

Locations - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Jobs Competence around the world The headquarters of the Fassmer Group is the Fassmer GmbH & Co. KG site in Berne, Germany, on the River Weser. Located directly beside the river, the company site houses the administration offices, our development and design department and production workshops for all five product divisions – Shipbuilding, Lifeboats, Deck Equipment, Wind Power and Composite Technology. The main offices of our service subsidiary Fassmer Service GmbH & Co. KG are also on this site; Fassmer Service America LLC is located in Miami, our service-company Fassmer Singapore Pte.Ltd. in Singapore Another member of the group, Fassmer Schiffsservice GmbH & Co. KG , founded in 1996, operates from Rechlin, Germany. This company designs and builds components for our deck equipment division. Markos sp.z.o.o. in Globino, Poland, is a joint venture with a Polish partner. In modern production halls, we manufacture fibre composite components for lifeboats, wind turbines, yachts and power boats. Fassmer-Marland in Guangzhou, China, is a joint venture set up in 2005. The newly built and equipped office and production facilities are focused on the production of lifeboats, davits and boarding systems, primarily for the Asian market. Fr. Fassmer GmbH & Co. Winches - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Deck Equipment Boarding Systems Davits Gangways Working rafts-/ baskets Bulwark ladder and swivel platforms Winches After-Sales Service Global Service Net Fassmer Winches Fassmer provides winches of different sizes and different operational purposes . Fassmer winches are designed in-house to ensure best operational results in combination with the chosen davit. Small winches for rescue boat operations or winches to operate XXL tender boats up to 45 tonnes are available as a friction brake solution or with a hydraulic brake system . All winches are electrically driven and fully approved according to the SOLAS / LSA Code.

Gangways - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Deck Equipment Boarding Systems Davits Gangways Working rafts-/ baskets Bulwark ladder and swivel platforms Winches After-Sales Service Global Service Net Standard Products Gangway Fassmer gangways are made of seawater-resistant aluminium and are suitable for merchant and passenger sea ships and pier-jetty-arrangements. All product variations comply with the regulations of international classification societies. The gangways vary in length from 2 to 20 m and can be from 2.000 to 600 mm wide. Their working range extends from -30° to 30° in relation to the horizontal line. GRP-built gangways This is an extraordinary example of the company’s innovative potential and effective use of internal synergies. This gangway forms part of the standard product line for boarding systems, and its product features are worth mentioning. The gangway shown at the right measures 3m in length and was built for installation on a cruise vessel. The advantages of the material combination of glass-fibre-reinforced-plastic and aluminum are its straight and non-skid surface and its light weight. The geometry of the gangway is modified to follow the individual requirements of each vessel. Various types are available, and different widths and lengths can be produced on demand. Working raft Made of seawater-resistant aluminium, this working raft also complies with the regulations of international classification societies. This product is also available with an outboard motor. Please refer to the below table to compare the two standard product variations available: Type A Length & width: 2.20m x 2.30m Height: 1.25m Weight: 160kg Capacity: one person Type B Length & Width: 2.20m x 3.30m Height: 1.25m Weight: 195kg Capacity: two persons Working basket This working basket is built to carry a maximum of 3 persons. It is made of seawater-resistant aluminium. One of its sides is equipped with special treads to permit crew to enter. If required, it can also be delivered with a door. Bulwark ladder Made of seawater-resistant aluminium, the Fassmer bulwark ladder comes with a plug-in pipe railing on both sides and a head plate for attachment to the bulwark profile or tube. The possible heights of the bulwark can vary from 0.90m to 1.50m; the width between the side profiles measures 760mm. If required, the product can be adapted to fit other dimensions as well. Swivel platform Made of seawater-resistant aluminium or hot dipped galvanized steel. The platform can be turned to a maximum of 180°and folded to a maximum of 9°.

Pivot Davits - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Deck Equipment Boarding Systems Davits Pivot Davits Multi-pivot Davits Freefall Pivots Hydraulic Davits Outrigger Davits Slewing Arm Davits Gangways Working rafts-/ baskets Bulwark ladder and swivel platforms Winches After-Sales Service Global Service Net Fassmer Pivot Davit The Fassmer pivot davit is a simple inside-ship solution made for freestanding installation . The electric winch is fully protected against icing-up and corrosion; long lifetime and pure gravity operation make this Davit a perfect choice for most cargo vessels. The inclusion of the proven Fassmer Duplex Release System – a hydrostatic interlock system – guarantees the safe release of the boat, once the loaded boat is waterborne. Fassmer pivot davits are available in different sizes for different boats.

Special Operation Boats - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Lifeboats Lifeboats and Tenders Rescue and Fast Rescue Boats Life- and Rescue Boats for Yachts Special Operation Boats Davits After-Sales Service Global Service Net Your flexible partner Special operation boats are vessels that can be used for multiple purposes . These vessels are of a certain type that can be characterised as work or operating boats of flexible size, construction material and technical equipment . Possible usage scenarios in a military context are: Special operation forces Boarding, accessing other ships Escorting ships Transport / shipment Diving, rescuing if certified as a life-saving appliance These boats are not primarily for use as life-saving appliances. Nevertheless they may be used as lifeboats or rescue boats if their technical characteristics comply with the standard regulations for life-saving appliances. Life- and Rescue Boats for Yachts - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Lifeboats Lifeboats and Tenders Rescue and Fast Rescue Boats Life- and Rescue Boats for Yachts Special Operation Boats Davits After-Sales Service Global Service Net Beautifully safe With this boat Fassmer has invented a new generation of elegant combined lifeboats, rescue boats and tenders . They are fast, unsinkable and self-righting lifesavers. This is the boat yacht owners have waited for! The SEL-RT 8.5 is built in a beautiful and exclusive double shell design . It never loses its buoyancy, not even in the unlikely case of complete flooding. For its main purpose as a partially enclosed lifeboat it is able to carry up to 40 persons and in case of emergency a three person-crew can rescue up to 6 persons very fast. As a yacht tender up to 20 persons enter the comfortable watertight passenger seating area through a large door. The boat is equipped with intelligent hoisting hooks which open on their own when the tender reaches the water. The SEL-RT 8.5 is according to SOLAS standards. Lifeboats & Rescue Boats - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Lifeboats Lifeboats and Tenders Rescue and Fast Rescue Boats Life- and Rescue Boats for Yachts Special Operation Boats Davits After-Sales Service Global Service Net Safety at Sea by Fassmer From the company's early beginnings in 1850 Fassmer has been contributing to safety at sea with innovative Lifeboats, Davits, Winches and Rescue boats. Through our inhouse research and design department we are constantly working to further improve the safety and reliability of our marine life-saving solutions. We continue to set higher safety standards and have cooperated with IMO and governmental authorities to integrate such improved safety standards into new regulations. Our global service network provides maintenance, spare parts, repairs, refurbishments and training.

Fassmer Service - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Shipbuilding SAR-/ Patrol Vessels Offshore Survey-/ Research Ships Offshore Support- / Service Vessels Work Vessels and Pilot Boats Yachts Ferries Naval Vessels Research, Design and Production Fassmer Service A fully integrated process at Fassmer At Fassmer clients can rely on a highly sophisticated and fully integrated process ranging from high-level consultations, research and design to perfect after-sales service including logistic and technical support, training and know-how transfer. Research Fassmer enjoys an excellent reputation for innovation in the maritime sector . We constantly examine and improve the operational behaviour and performance of our customer-specific designed products. Design In view of the large number of tailor-made vessels we produce, our experienced in-house design department plays a major role at Fassmer. We can offer our customers the best possible support in all aspects and all phases of a project – from the first layout plan, basic and detailed design up to plant maintenance systems. Production Modern production facilities and a highly skilled workforce are the prerequisites for the famous Fassmer quality backed up by on-time delivery. Based on a long tradition that started in 1850 we have always done our utmost to ensure our customers’ complete satisfaction in every respect! After-Sales Service Given that you may expect a lifetime of well over 30 years for a Fassmer vessel, it goes without saying that you can rely equally on our after-sales service. We can ensure the availability of our vessels by offering: A worldwide service network that ensures the safe and reliable operation of your vessels Plant maintenance systems Crew training Delivery of spare parts and tools Technical support in all aspects Technical co-operation If a customer is interested in one of our well-proven vessels but prefers construction on a shipyard in his own country, Fassmer is the right partner to choose. For such technical co-operation we provide a wide range of services such as: Transfer of shipbuilding expertise Well-proven designs within an extensive product range Tailor-made basic and detailed designs Assigned project managers and engineers to provide professional assistance at any level Logistic support to ensure smooth production Effective training programmes Material packages up to prefabricated shipbuilding kits Repairs and Conversions Fassmer also offers all kinds of repairs and conversions. Our customers appreciate our modern ship lift which complies with the latest environmental requirements, as well as our heated workshops.

The company’s operating goals are top quality and customer satisfaction. An expert in-house design and engineering team backed up by modern production facilities provides Fassmer with an exceptional capacity for innovation and ingenious technical solutions in shipbuilding. Fassmer can look back on a long tradition in the design and construction of one-off custom-built special purpose vessels. Our shipbuilding activities cover a wide range of products. Kommen Sie an Bord! Fassmer ist ein weltweit erfolgreiches, innovatives Familienunternehmen in fünfter Generation. Zwischen den sechs Geschäftsbereichen Schiffbau, Rettungsbootbau, Anlagenbau, Windkraft, Faserverbundtechnik und After-Sales Service ergeben sich hervorragende Synergie-Effekte. Der Name Fassmer steht für innovative Entwicklungen, modernste Fertigungseinrichtungen, Qualität, Kompetenz und Verlässlichkeit – der sich auch die weltweit rund 900 Mitarbeiter verpflichtet fühlen. Company - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Jobs Fassmer – synergy of expertise and passion Fassmer is a dynamic family-owned shipyard in its fifth generation. The internationally successful company is active in six business areas: Shipbuilding, Lifeboats, Deck Equipment, Wind Power, Composite Technology and After-Sales Service. Our clients appreciate the close cooperation with research institutes, innovative in-house design and engineering, modern production facilities and a worldwide service network . We are one team Each step within the construction and production process demands maximum performance. This can only be reached with highly qualified employees and regular training sessions . More than 900 people work for Fassmer worldwide, half of them in Germany. Their expert knowledge and motivated attitude to their work reflecting the duties they fulfill represent the company’s great potential! Benefit from other business areas. Convincing synergy-effects between the six business areas are a great advantage for the company. The client profits from the cumulative expertise!

21 m Fast Patrol Boat - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Shipbuilding SAR-/ Patrol Vessels Offshore Survey-/ Research Ships Offshore Support- / Service Vessels Work Vessels and Pilot Boats Yachts Ferries Naval Vessels Special Operation Boats Research, Design and Production Fassmer Service 21 m Fast Patrol Boat (FFPB 21) This series of 21-m fast patrol boats was delivered to the Cambodian Navy and to the Bulgarian Coastguard . The patrol boats were designed to achieve a maximum speed of 34 knots . The modern hull design permits excellent seagoing characteristics even at high speeds. In order to arrive at a local cost-saving construction Fassmer cooperated with local shipyards. In such cases we always offer shipyard and crew training, design packages, technology transfer, technical documentation, material packages and supervision. PRESS RELEASE 02/09 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs Press Release 02/09 Fassmer delivers new search and rescue cruiser to German life-saving organization „Deutsche Gesellschaft zur Rettung Schiffsbrüchiger“ (DGzRS). On January 6, 2009, company Fr. Fassmer handed over the first of two 19.9 m long search and rescue cruisers to the Deutsche Gesellschaft zur Rettung Schiffsbrüchiger. The name of the new search and rescue cruiser is “EISWETTE”. This name was chosen by the life-savers to honour the traditional and generous commitment of the Bremer Eiswett-Genossen and their guests, who donate money to the DGzRS on occasion of their annual foundation party. This custom is practiced since 1828/29. Britta Braun, wife of the President of the Eiswett-Genossen, crashed the traditional bottle of champagne on the shell of the new search and rescue cruiser, and wished the crew „always good cruising and safe return!“. Dr. Julie Smidt, wife of this year’s speaker of the Eiswette novices, christened the daughter boat on the name of NOVIZE. This special ship, of 19.90 m length and with 38 to displacement, passed an extensive test program over the last weeks in the North Sea, sometimes in very bad weather and heavy sea conditions. This special ship, the first of a new class, has 1660 PS and makes 22 knots (approx. 40 km/h). It will be used on the Station Nordstrand (in the German region of Schleswig-Holstein). In 2006, Fassmer was contracted for construction and production of 2 search and rescue cruisers of that type. The second new vessel was put into operation at the end of January 2009. The search and rescue cruiser is sailed by a crew of three. The requirements to the new cruiser are mainly close-to-coast operation, but also in rather shallow waters. With a draught of only 1.30 meters, the EISWETTE can be shipped in areas where bigger search and rescue cruisers depend on their daughter boats. Of course, EISWETTE maintains the highest safety levels, even under extreme weather conditions in open sea, as all units in the rescue fleet do. Fassmer choose a design without an accommodation deck which in the past used to be built on board of search and rescue cruisers. The crew is not housed on board, but in the station building on the island. The search and rescue cruiser can be staffed very quickly, and sail out on its mission. Other special features of this ship type are the well-proven net frame structure, the workplace in ergonomic design and the extensive medical equipment for first aid on board. A fire-fighting pump with a capacity of 2,300 l/min can be used in case of fire on sea. The electronic on-board network via data bus system is another novelty. This special lines system serves for transfer of data and energy between control elements and electric systems, as applied for instance in computers but also in airplanes, and more and more frequently in complex machines and modern automobiles. This increases the security of operations and saves a lot of weight. The open work boat type in the stern ramp is also new. With the new “service boat” NOVIZE, which makes 37 knots (approx. 68 km/h), the EISWETTE still has a powerful boat to assist missions, and to go in shallow waters. A proven design was chosen for the hull of the new search and rescue cruiser. By optimizing the lines the yard realized excellent seaworthiness. The main engine is widely free of auxiliary aggregates, and virtually available exclusively for driving the high-resilient carbon fibre propeller. This improves the manoeuvring characteristics and especially the operational safety. The sophisticated hydraulic system always provides enough energy in normal operations for the electronic on-board network, the fire-fighting pump, or the bow thruster. When the main engine fails, there is also a hydraulic stand-by drive to bring the search and rescue cruiser safely out of the hazardous area, and back to the safe harbour. Of course, this new vessel type is designed as self-righting in case of capsizing, as all search and rescue cruisers are. Company Fr. Fassmer carried out a very elaborate capsizing test with the almost finished ship in the presence of the DGzRS. The tests verified the calculations of the yard. The hull which had been keel-up in water, righted itself in one time. Technical Data of the 19.90 m search and rescue cruiser “EISWETTE“ Main dimensions Overall length: 19.90 m Overall width: 4.75 m Draught: 1.30 m Displacement: 39.30 t Classification: GL+100 A5 OC4 „Rescue Vessel“ Performance Max. Speed: 22 Kn Range: Approx. 400 nm / 22 kn Load Fuel: 6000 l Fresh water: 250 l Crew: 3 Persons Material Rump: Aluminium Structures: Aluminium Drive / Stand-by engine Main drive: Caterpillar C32. 1232 kW Gear: 2-speed Reintjes gear. ZWVS 440 Propeller: 5-blade carbon fibre propeller; AIR Bow light(s): Type 460, 7.5 kN

PRESS RELEASE 07/09 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs PRESS RELEASE 07/09 GREENPEACE ORDERS TECHNOLOGICALLY-ADVANCED RAINBOW WARRIOR III. Greenpeace International Executive Director Gerd Leipold, today signed a contract with the Fassmer Shipyard for construction of the Rainbow Warrior III. The sailing ship, which is to be completed in time for Greenpeace's 40th anniversary in 2011, will include the very latest in green technology making it ideal for use in Greenpeace's campaign to avert catastrophic climate change. This is the first time in the environmental organisation's history that it has chosen to commission a purpose-built ship instead of refurbishing an older one. The organisation maintains that even in these difficult financial times, environmental protection must remain the international community's single greatest priority. 'Greenpeace is demanding that politicians and individuals alike to make policy and investment decisions based upon environmental imperatives. Just as this is the right thing for them to do, so it is the right thing for Greenpeace, too. Now it is not the time to short change future generations,” Leipold explained. The Rainbow Warrior III will be built primarily to sail (thus using wind energy instead of fossil fuels), with the option in unsuitable weather conditions to switch over to enginepowered, diesel-electric propulsion. The A-frame design of the mast and the positioning of the sails have been optimised for efficiency and the shape of the hull has been designed for maximum fuel conservation. Heat created by the generators will be re-used to heat water on board and for engine pre-heating. 'The Rainbow Warrior II has been a great ship, with a proud record of effecting environmental change, but even great warriors need to be retired' Leipold said at the contract signing ceremony. 'The Rainbow Warrior is synonymous with Greenpeace, with taking a stand to defend the planet, and is an icon of hope world wide. Not only does it provide Greenpeace with a platform to challenge environmental abuse across the world, it provides people with inspiration to take action of their own. More than ever the world needs the hope and inspiration provided by the Rainbow Warrior.” Technical specifications vessel Rainbow Warrior III Main dimensions Length over all: 57,92 m Beam (Max.): 11,30 m Design Draft: 5,00 m Air draught: 50,50 m Tonnage: Approx 838 GT

PRESS RELEASE 01/10 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs PRESS RELEASE 01/10 LIFEBOAT AND DAVIT MANUFACTURER FR. FASSMER AND LIFEBOAT LAUNCH SYSTEM SUPPLIER NADIRO ENTERS INTO COOPERATION AGREEMENT Danish company Nadiro A/S and German company Fr. Fassmer GmbH & Co KG has signed a cooperation agreement enabling customers to order Fassmer lifeboats with Nadiro’s Drop-In-Ball™ and a full launching system including a protecting container around the lifeboat which combines the Nadiro and Fassmer products. Esben Juul Sørensen, Managing Director of Nadiro, looks forward to the cooperation and expects to gain valuable knowledge and capture market shares from the cooperation: “Our customers expressed a wish for us to partner up with an experienced lifeboat manufacturer and therefore Fassmer was the natural choice. Nadiro is a newly founded company but the Drop-In-Ball™ and the enclosed launching system has received very positive attention from the industry. We consider cooperation with a high quality lifeboat and davit manufacturer like Fassmer another blue stamp of Nadiro and a possibility to grow further in the future”. Fassmer already offers complete systems with their own Duplex® Release Hook which is also in conformity with the new regulations like DE 52 conventional hooks, however Fassmer Sales Manager Norbert Kotte, considers the agreement vital in capturing potential changes in the market: “We expect to see changes in the industry due to new safety regulations and general demand for increased safety from seafarers. Even though we are very content with our current product portfolio, we always strive towards getting better and meeting new customer needs. If the Drop-In-Ball is the future, we want to be in the game from the beginning” says Fassmer Sales Manager Norbert Kotte. Contact: Esben Juul Sørensen, Nadiro +45 61203808 or Norbert Kotte, Fassmer +49 4406 942-130 Nadiro is owned 80% by Danish A.P. Moller – Maersk Group and 20% by Danish SH Group and was founded in June 2009. Nadiro produces a drop-in-ball™ system, replacing conventional lifeboat hooks and a full solution covering the lifeboat on deck to increase safety. Fassmer is a family owned German company founded in 1850 with over 900 employees. Fassmer is working in four main areas: Shipbuilding, Lifeboats/Davits, Access Systems and Fibreglass Technology. Fassmer has the experience and expertise it takes to guarantee maximum quality in all phases of design, engineering and production.

PRESS RELEASE 03/10 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs PRESS RELEASE 03/10 New Survey Vessel for Fugro Delivery: 12 March 2010 Operator: Fugro Survey Ltd – Aberdeen Port of registry: Panama New Construction: 3050 The company Fassmer has delivered its latest new building, the first of two ordered 65 m Survey Vessels for the FUGRO Group. The vessel is designed for geophysical research and survey with state of the art sounding and survey equipment in world-wide operation. Fassmer and Fugro have taken this opportunity to look at all aspects of overall survey vessel design in detail considering the latest equipment, making them the most advanced vessels of their type in the world. The vessels will operate in the offshore oil and gas industry and the offshore renewable energy sector. They will be able to carry out the full range of site and route survey tasks to obtain the high resolution data necessary for safe, efficient and cost-effective planning, design and engineering activities involving the seabed and the installation of pipelines, platforms, wind turbines, subsea structures etc. The FUGRO SEARCHER has a maximum crew of 42 persons and can operate continuously 35 days at sea. The range of the vessel is 6000 nm at 10kn cruising speed. A maximum speed of 13.4 kn has been achieved at sea trails. For survey equipment the ship provides a workdeck of 360 sqm free area with flush deck twist lock foundations. Modular seismic winches and equipment can be arranged on the workdeck within short mobilisation periodes. The propulsion system is of diesel electric concept with two ducted z-drive propellers and bowthruster. It is designed for station keeping work as well as towing seismic systems at low noise levels. The FUGRO SEARCHER hull is designed to minimize in water noise for accurate research performance. To achieve this rotating machinery and pressurised loaded pipes are elastically supported. The bow shape is designed to minimize the appearance of air bubbles at the bow wave. The shape of the fore hull forces remaining air bubbles to the surface in order to have a steady water flow at the sounding gondola. The hull design has been CFD calculated and tested in a towing tank and the results were verified during seatrails with underwater camera and hydrophone tests. The accommodation area has berths for 42 persons in double and single cabins. For survey and research work rooms for on line navigation, data processing, instrument room, office and two workshops are available. The social life on board will take place in the messroom with leisure area, recreation room with movie system and gymnasium.Due to the intensive noise reduction for in water the inside noise levels are also 5-10dB(A) lower than required by IMO. All cabins are fully air conditioned, have a bathroom with shower and a TV system. The below keel mounted gondola is approx. 12 m in length and was hydrodynamically tested in a towing tank. It contains echosounders for multibeam, single beam and subbottom profiling. The work deck area contains a knuckle boom crane 3 tons at 12 m, a 7,5 t Aframe, two 2.5 tons sliding booms and a gravity corer launch system. FUGRO SEARCHER is designed to carry 75 tons of deck load which can be attached via the ISO twist lock system. Hydraulic, electric and seismic high pressure air power supplies are all available on the working deck. The high pressure air is produced by 4 water cooled compressors up to 200 bars for continuous operation of multi air guns and mini air gun in parallel mode. At the seatrails the vessel was outfitted and tested with multi air gun, streamer winch, mini-gun and mini streamer as well as with side scan sonar. All systems can be operated in simultaneously. The marine and survey test and trials have been more than successful. Fassmer delivers this custom made vessel not only in compliance with Fugro’s requirements but also exactly on time. Technical Data of the Survey Vessel „FUGRO SEARCHER“ Main dimensions Length over all: 65,65 m Width over all: 14,00 m Design draft: 4,20 m Displacement: 1851 t Classification: GL+100 A5 “Survey Vessel” IW + MC AUT Performance Speed: 12,8 knots Max. Speed: 13,4 knots Range min.: 6000 nm Endurance, min.: 35 days Dead Weight Fuel oil: 253 t Potable Water: 158 t Complement: 42 persons Material Hull: Steel grade A Superstructure: Steel grade A Propulsion System Propulsion: 3 gensets each 1138 kVA Propulsion engine: 2 x 1100 kW Propeller: 2 x ruderpropeller SRP1010, 2100mm, ducted Bowthruster: 400 kW Special Equipment The suite of survey equipment will include an EA600 single-beam echo sounder, EM302 and EM3002 multibeam echosounders, Edgetech dual frequency 4200 digital sidescan sonar, chirp sub-bottom profiler, Hydroscience SeeMUX digital system, with a seismic source of up to 970cu in firing into a 3000 metre long solid digital streamer, and a HiPAP 500 USBL system. The vessel will be fully networked to provide full plug-and-play interconnectivity and have Fugro's dual DGPS high-precision Navigation systems. The design of the vessel will permit simultaneous analogue/digital survey operations and AUV operations. Geotechnical and ROVSV duties can also be undertaken. Diesel-electric drive, specially designed hull form, resilient engine mounts and rudder propellers will maximise station keeping and navigational control while ensuring acoustically quiet running at survey speeds.

NEWS 11/10 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs NEWS 11/2010 Fassmer takes 50% holding in SSB We are proud to announce that Fassmer has taken a 50 %-holding in the SSB (Schiffs- und Stahlbau Berne) former Rolandwerft. This shareholding enables us to benefit from the approved work of our partner SSB. The company's production facilities are equipped with a ship lift with 4800 t lifting capacity measuring 140 metres in length and 25 metres in width, five big revolving cranes , a mobile crane and a spacious workshop area (measuring about 11.000 square metres ). With an increased capacity in workmanship and production resources, our customers can rest assured that we will meet their increasing demands for passionate solutions in Shipbuilding.
